page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Most of the area is fertile arable land with large open fields producing mainly wheat, barley, sugar beet and oil seed rape. There are some small areas of grassland for grazing, hay and silage; and even smaller areas of maize and beet for fodder. Some of the small family farms practise mixed farming, while the larger farms are almost entirely arable. There are a few dairy herds,none very large, and some of the small farms keep a few beef cattle and pigs. There is one intensive pig farm, 4 fairly large and 1 smaller intensive poultry units,also 1 small farm that rears turkeys, mainly for Christmas. In the North-East corner is one intensive poultry-rearing and processing factory dealing mainly with ducks and geese. This farm has many of its rearing pens outside this block.
